intro: Anisochilus purpureus, commonly known as the purple leaf fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds. The plant features bright purple and green variegated leaves, which give it its common name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, moist soil. Anisochilus purpureus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of care.
